title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 363.3 - Election
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 363.3 - Election

State Regulations
A member of the New York State and Local Employees'
Retirement System who is covered by article 14 of the Retirement and Social

Security Law and who, on the effective date of service or vested
retirement: (a) has not attained age
60 and has accrued less than 30 years of credited service; or
(b) has not attained age 62, and has accrued
at least 20, but less than 25 years of credited service, shall receive benefits
calculated under the provisions of article 15 of the Retirement and Social

Security Law unless the individual files a timely election, as provided in
section
363.4
of this Part, to receive
benefits calculated under the provisions of article 14. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 2
ยง
363.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
